# APPLICATION STREAMING

![OS](https://images.pexels.com/photos/62627/niagara-cases-water-waterfall-62627.jpeg?&h=300)

---

## WHY WEB TECHNOLOGIES ?

---

### THE PROBLEM FOR DEVELOPERS

* How to publish your application to users ?
  * 1980... Floppy Disk
  * 1990... DVD
  * 2000... Internet Download
  * 2010... App Store, Google Play
  * 2020... Progressive Web Apps
    * Application Streaming

---

### APPLICATION STREAMING

* To publish your application
* Progressive Web Apps (PWA) are
  * 🚀 Fast 
  * 👍 Easy
  * ✅ Cheap
* Everyone has a smartphone 
  * 📲 With a browser included
  * 🌍 With internet connection

---

## USER STORIES

* Use cases
* The application code must cover all use cases
* But one user only performs one use case at a time
* No need to load all the code 😱 
  * small application: 10.000 lines of code
  * medium application: 100.000 lines of code
  * big application: 1.000.000 lines of code
  * ...

---

### EXAMPLES

* Register as new user / Only once 🔥
* Login / Every day 😎
* Lost password / Maybe once a year ? 😅
* Delete account / Never ? 😱

---

## APPLICATION STREAMING

* Load only the code needed for the use case
  * 👍 Better experience for the user (UX) 
  * 🚀 Better performance for the application
  * ✅ Less resources used 
  * ⛨ Better security for the application 

---

### PWA: APPLICATION STREAMING

* Progressive Web Application
* Front: JS modules
* Back: PHP class autoloader
* ...

---

## WHY DEVELOPERS NEED OBJECT ORIENTED PROGRAMMING ?

* Object Oriented Programming (OOP)
  * Tools for professional developer teams
  * Very popular since 1990 (C++, Java, C#, PHP, ...)
* For Application Streaming ?
  * Is everything useful in OOP ? 🤔

---

### DEVELOPER DAY

* 7 hours / day 
* => 420 minutes
  * 400 minutes 
  * (+ 2 pauses x10 minutes)
* Expected volume of code ? 😅
  * 400 lines of code per day
  * 1 line of code / minute ?! 😎

---

### 4 X 100 LINES OF CODE

---

---

## DEVELOPER DAILY TASKS

* 3 main tasks
  * Design
  * Code     
  * Test + Debug

* Coding 
  * 1 line of code
  * => 20 seconds 😅

---

### DEVELOPER WEEK

* 7 days
* 5 working days
* 5 * 400 = 2.000 lines of code

---

### DEVELOPER YEAR

* 52 weeks
* 50 * 2.000 = 100.000 lines of code
* => for one developer 😎

* Team x4 developers 😎😎😎😎
* => 4 x 100.000 
* 400.000 lines of code / year
* 🔥🔥🔥🔥 
* A team must have a good code organisation 
  * to be able to work together

---

### SOFTWARE ENGINEERING IS ABOUT HUMAN LIMITS

* The limit in coding is now human brain capacity
* From a computer point of view
  * Each developer could write all his code in his own file
  * team with 4 developers 
  * => 4 files x 100.000 lines of code in each file 😱

---

## CODE ORGANISATION

---

### OS (OPERATING SYSTEM)

* OS to use a computer
* storage organisation on hard disk
  * Files and Folders 
  * ...and Subfolders
* Tree structure 🎄

![OS](https://images.pexels.com/photos/38136/pexels-photo-38136.jpeg?&h=300)

---

### PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE 

* A programming language 
  * Is a tool to write code
* Needed features: Organisation of code
  * Will also propose a tree structure 🎄
* Functions 🎁
* Classes 🎁

---

## FUNCTIONS

* Organize your code in functions
* => Give a different name to each function
* (👍 tip: use a verb in the name of the function)

---

### EXAMPLE

```php

function doTask1 ($param1, $param2) 
{
    // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    // 100 LINES OF CODE...
}

function doTask2 ($param1, $param2) 
{
    // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    // 100 LINES OF CODE...
}

function doTask3 ($param1, $param2) 
{
    // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    // 100 LINES OF CODE...
}

// ...

function doTask100 ($param1, $param2) 
{
    // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    // 100 LINES OF CODE...
}

// 100 FUNCTIONS * 100 LINES OF CODE
// = 10.000 LINES OF CODE
// => NEED TO ORGANIZE YOUR FUNCTIONS

```

---

### LIMITS OF FUNCTIONS ?

* 100 * 100 = 10.000 lines of code
* Good for small applications
* ...if bigger applications
* 😱 Need to organize your functions

---

## OBJECT ORIENTED PROGRAMMING (OOP)

* When you have lot of functions
* Organise your functions in classes
* => Give a different name to each class
* (👍 tip: use a noun in the name of the function)

---

### EXAMPLE

```php

class Service1
{
    function doTask1 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    }

    function doTask2 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    }
    // ...
}

class Service2
{
    function doTask10 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
        // 100 LINES OF CODE...
    }

    function doTask20 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
        // 100 LINES OF CODE...
    }

    // ...
}

// ...

class Service100
{
    // ...
}

// 100 CLASSES 
// * 100 FUNCTIONS 
// * 100 LINES OF CODE
// = 1.000.000 LINES OF CODE

```

---

### LIMITS OF CLASSES ?

* 100 classes 
* x 100 functions 
* x 100 lines of code
* = 1.000.000 lines of code
* => 🔥 Good for a professional project 😎

---

## FRONT: JS MODULES

* Dynamic import of JS files
* Coder can split JS code in modules
* dynamic import
  * `await import(url)`
* https://javascript.info/modules-dynamic-imports
  

```js
// module1.js
export function doTask1 () {
    // ...
}
```

```js
// module2.js
export function doTask2 () {
    // ...
}
```

```js
// module3.js
let usecase = document.getElementById('usecase').value;

export function doTask3 () {
  // load code from modules if needed
  if (usecase == '1') {
    let module1 = await import('./module1.js');
    module1.doTask1();
  }

  if (usecase == '2') {
    let module2 = await import('./module2.js');
    module2.doTask2();
  }

}

```

## BACK: PHP CLASS AUTOLOAD

* PHP class autoload
* https://www.php.net/manual/en/function.spl-autoload-register.php

---

```php
// index.php
class index
{
    // callabck activated by PHP engine when a class definition is needed
    // better performance
    static function autoload ($classname) {
        include __DIR__ . "/class/$classname.php";
    }

    static function run ()
    {
        // install our autoload callback
        spl_autoload_register("index::autoload");
        // ...
    }
}

// activate the application
index::run();

```

---

### STATIC OR OBJECT METHODS ?

```php
// index.php
class index
{
    // ...

    static function run ()
    {
        // install our autoload callback
        spl_autoload_register("index::autoload");

        // service1.php (by class)
        service1::doTask1();

        // service2.php (by object)
        $service2 = new service2();
        $service2->doTask2();
    }
}

// activate the application
index::run();

```

---

### STATIC METHODS

```php
// class/service1.php
class service1
{
    static function doTask1 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    }

    static function doTask2 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    }

    // ...
}
```

---

### OBJECT METHODS

```php
// class/service2.php
class service2
{
    function doTask10 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    }

    function doTask20 ($param1, $param2) 
    {
        // PUT YOUR CODE HERE
    }

    // ...
}
```
